main event: A sighting of one silver, dome-shaped object larger than a basketball rising slowly toward the West in Delamero, North Dakota on August 4, 1956.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for forty-four minutes during the daytime., The object was described as a dome shape and silver in color., The observer reported the object was rising slowly toward the west., A weather balloon was noted to be in the area at the time of the sighting., The sighting was confirmed to conform to criteria for a balloon.
